climbs.name: Inferior Icefall
climbs.fa: S. Parent, P. Powell, A. Chong, 1991

content.description:
This is the crown jewel of the area! It is the second icefall on the left as you're walking down the tracks and unmistakable. 
  
 Pitch 1 (WI 3+) Pick a pillar at the base that will allow access to a wide ledge and climb for about 75 feet until you find a comfortable belay spot. 
  
 Pitches 2-4 (WI 2-2+) Pick your way through the remaining 400'-500' of slabby ice with occasional steep and thin sections. Belay at comfortable stances.

Screws

The first route on your left in the main area. Hike up the drainage to the base.  
  
 Pitch 1 (WI 2+) Climb about 150 feet to the base of the main flow. 
  
 Pitch 2 (WI 3) Climb the main flow for about 75 feet.

Screws

climbs.name: Superior Icefall
climbs.fa: S. Parent, J. Carson, F. Pianka, 1991

content.description:
The third and final of the big routes in the main area. This is Inferior Icefall's little brother. It can be made to have an alpine flair in heavy snow cover by extending the approach pitch. 
  
 Approach (Easy Snow) Climb snowy gully system 
 Pitch 1 (WI 2) Hop onto the ice when it feels comfortable and climb about 75 feet until the route notably steepens. 
 Pitch 2 (WI 2+) Climb the steeper upper sections for about 150 feet to the top.

Screws

pathTokens: LAKE SUPERIOR W: Marathon to Thunder Bay, includes Kama and Orient Bay

content.description: The main area at Ice Station Superior contains the three big climbs that make this area special.
